ai.summary: H100 - Esh Winning and Waterhouses is a 7.5 km moderate hike in the UK, linking the villages of Esh Winning and Waterhouses. The route mixes country lanes, field paths, and small ascents, offering farmland and countryside views for most of the way. Suitable for hikers with some experience and comfortable footwear.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain combines surfaced country lanes with unpaved footpaths and grassy field edges. Expect uneven ground, occasional mud after rain, and several gates or stiles. Elevation changes are gentle to moderate, with some hedgerow shade and open countryside views.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy boots and weather-appropriate clothing. Check the forecast and daylight hours; navigation is straightforward but carry a map or GPS. Stay on public rights of way; be mindful of traffic on any lanes. Watch for livestock in fields, gate etiquette, and carry a small first aid kit and water. In wet conditions, be prepared for slippery surfaces and mud.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) are the best seasons for this hike in the UK. Winter walking is possible but can be muddy and daylight is shorter.

seo.title: H100 – Esh Winning to Waterhouses Walk (7.5 km) | Moderate UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore the 7.5 km H100 route from Esh Winning to Waterhouses in the UK. A moderate hike along country lanes and footpaths with countryside scenery.
